instruction: What metric was chosen to evaluate the estimation models and how well did they perform in the related study for assessing the ripeness of crops at harvest?
Output: The metric chosen to evaluate the estimation models was the coefficient of determination (R-2) and the root mean square error (RMSE). The models performed well, with an R-2 value of 0.70 and an RMSE of 1.21 for the estimation of soluble solid content (SSC), and an R-2 value of 0.67 and an RMSE of 0.91 for the estimation of titratable acidity (TA).

instruction: How were the artificial neural network models trained to estimate the ripening status indicators using the pre-process reflectance measurements as input in the related study for assessing the ripeness of crops at harvest?
Output: The artificial neural network models were trained using a leave-one-out cross-validation approach. In the approach, each sample in the dataset is used as a test sample once, while the remaining samples are used as training data. The pre-process reflectance measurements of the samples were used as input for the neural network models. The models were trained to estimate the two target parameters, soluble solid content (SSC) and titratable acidity (TA), based on the reflectance measurements. The performance of the models was evaluated using the R-2 (coefficient of determination) and RMSE (root mean square error) metrics.
